project.description:
This jobs keeps the configuration of this Jenkins in sync with the configuration in git. This allows several developers to share one configuration controlled from one repository.
After pulling a configuration, Jenkins has to read the new configuration. It is not enough to re-read the old jobs, since new jobs may have arrived or old jobs removed$
Restarting: A restart will kill all running jobs, which is not what you want. A mechanism to postpone restarts untill no jobs are running could/should be implemented.
Push vs. pull: It would be nice to pull changes instead of pulling. This requires that the external repo can reach this machine. Since this machine will run as guest inside some host

hudson.triggers.TimerTrigger.spec:
# When developing poll every minute #* * * * *
# When done developing, poll every 15 minutes H/15 * * * *

hudson.tasks.Shell.command: cd ${JENKINS_HOME} echo 'Checking git to see if central configuration has changed.' if git checkout master && git fetch origin master && [ `git rev-list HEAD...origin/master --count` != 0 ] && git merge origin/master then # Signals SUCCESS so Jenkins can be restarted. If I restart Jenkins # from here, the status of the job will not be saved. echo 'Central configuration updated! Jenkins needs to be re-started to reflect changes' else echo 'Central configuration not updated, doing nothing. Sending FAILURE signal so other Jenkins jobs are aware of this' # Signals FAILURE, this is OK exit 1 fi
